intro: Deyeuxia levipes, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in temperate regions. Deyeuxia levipes has a rhizomatous growth habit, which allows it to spread and colonize new areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are wind-pollinated, a common feature in many Cyperaceae species.
